snippet: About two-thirds of about 41,000 children seeking seats for the next school year, in either full or half-day programs, were accommodated, Mayor Bill de Blasio said.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio says fewer than half of city children seeking free prekindergarten seat received one in their top-choice public school for the next school year; data highlights how thorny a task de Blasio faces in fulfilling his signature policy goal of broadening prekindergarten access to every 4-year-old.
lead_paragraph: About two-thirds of about 41,000 children seeking seats for the next school year, in either full or half-day programs, were accommodated, Mayor Bill de Blasio said.

headline.main: Less Than Half of New York City’s Applicants for Pre-K Get Their Top-Choice School
headline.print_headline: Less Than Half of the City’s Applicants for Free Pre-K Get Their Top-Choice School
